header.summary: I like to build autonomous systems

experience.description: I expanded Greensea's autonomy stack for a fleet of underwater robotics. This entailed localization, mapping, and obstacle avoidance for both holonomic and nonholonomic vehicles. Some projects I contributed towards are the following: EverClean (ship hull cleaning service), OPENSEA (hardware agnostic software for underwater robotics), Bayonet AUGV (sea floor surveying), and EOD (Explosive Ordnance Neutralization).

The main problem we were solving was related to multi-agent systems where we needed decisive coordination between multiple ground and air vehicles. I concentrated on sensor processing, mapping, and navigation for off-road ground automobiles.
I designed and implemented a data-driven nonlinear longitudinal and lateral controller for ground vehicles.
I designed, developed, and applied controls for a commercial vehicle. The team ultimately won 2nd place overall.

projects.name: GPT - The Office
projects.description: A Generative Pretrained Model (GPT) using a similar decoder architecture from "Attention is All You Need" utilizes scripts from "The Office" to create scripts similar to the show. There are two tokenization method:  character-wise tokens and GPT-2 tokens. While this was tested and trained on a singular GPU, I hope to move this project forward with multi-GPU processing.

projects.name: Rust Robotics
projects.description: Currently, this includes some basic downstream algorithms (system modeling, path tracking, and controls). The goal is to create algorithms for majority of the autonomy pipeline from sensor data processing to controls.

projects.name: samirhassen.com
projects.description: I'm not a frontend developer by any means, but I created this portfolio website using Brittany Chiang's website as inspiration. I learned and executed ideas in an unfamiliar domain.
